Surface

class pyrit.geometry.Surface(ext_curves: List[Curve], *int_curves: List[Curve], physical_tag: Optional[int] = None)

Bases: PrimitiveGeo

A class representing a surface.

Construct an instance of Surface.

Parameters

  • ext_curves (List[Curve]) – External curves.

  • *int_curves (List[Curve]) – Internal curves. For each hole in the surface a list of curves that define the hole.

  • physical_tag (int, optional) – The physical tag of the surface. The default is None.

Methods

add_to_gmsh

Add the surface to gmsh.

remove

Remove the Surface from GMSH.

reset_tag

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

rotate

Rotate the Surface.

translate

Translate the Surface.

Attributes

added

Check if the surface is already added to gmsh.

curves

Return a list of all curves.

dim

Get the dimension of the surface.

ext_curves

Get ext_curves.

has_holes

Get has_holes.

int_curves

Get int_curves.

num_curves

The number of curves.

physical_tag

tag

Get ext_curves.

Returns

External curves of the surface.

Return type

List[Curve]

property int_curves: List[Curve]

Get int_curves.

Returns

Internal curves of the surface.

Return type

Return a list of all curves.

Returns

All curves of the surface

Return type

List[Curve]

The number of curves.

Returns

Number of curves.

Return type

property has_holes: bool

Get has_holes.

Returns

True if surface has internal curves.

Return type

bool

property dim: int

Get the dimension of the surface.

Returns

Dimension of a surface.

Return type

int

property added: bool

Check if the surface is already added to gmsh.

Returns

True if surface has already been added to gmsh.

Return type

bool

add_to_gmsh()

Add the surface to gmsh.

Raises

Warning – When an object of class curve is part of the surface.

Return type

None.

remove(recursive=True)

Remove the Surface from GMSH.

Return type

None.

translate(dx: float, dy: float, dz: float)

Translate the Surface.

Parameters

  • dx (float) – Translation in x-direction

  • dy (float) – Translation in y-direction

  • dz (float) – Translation in z-direction

Return type

None.

rotate(angle_x: float, angle_y: float, angle_z: float, rotation_origin: ndarray = array([0, 0, 0]))

Rotate the Surface.

Note the order of the rotation: first x-axis, second y-axis, third around z-axis.

Parameters

  • angle_x (float) – Rotation angle around x-axis in radian

  • angle_y (float) – Rotation angle around y-axis in radian

  • angle_z (float) – Rotation angle around z-axis in radian

  • rotation_origin (np.ndarray, optional) – The origin around which is rotated. By default (0,0,0) is used.

Return type

None.

reset_tag() → None

Sets its own tag and the tags of all contained entities to None.

Return type

None
